derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (originally denoting a flood, especially one carrying suspended material which is then deposited): from French, from Latin alluvio (n-), from ad- 'towards' + luere 'to wash'

means.word_mean: 1. gradual formation of new land, by recession of the sea or deposit of sediment
2. the rising of a body of water and its overflowing onto normally dry land;
3. clay or silt or gravel carried by rushing streams and deposited where the stream slows down
